lines.text: BOOGEDY, BOOGEDY BOO!

[in conversation with the Widow Marian]
He preventeth you?
Time to call a realtor!
As we all know, there's no such things as ghosts.
You wanna bet?
Oh boy. This I gotta see. Dad's gonna negotiate with Mr. Hamburger Face.

[the boys are playing in the house chasing each other. In the kitchen, they see the toaster levitate, shake around, then settle back on the counter]
Huh. Dad?

[puts down his toy, and waves his hand over the toaster]
No wires.
Hmm.
[puts his toy down, and partially tilts the toaster over to inspect it. The toaster is unplugged, but we see the burner slits light up hot, which burns Corwin]
Ow!

[Suddenly, everything starts going crazy in the kitchen! The cabinet doors start to open and shut by themselves, the water turns on in the faucet by itself full stream, the kettle on the stove that is empty starts spraying steam out of its spout!]

[Evil cackling]
Heh! Heh! Heh!
[the boys grab their toys and run out of the kitchen]

[In the Historical Society, Neil is telling the story to the children of Lucifer Falls and how William Hanover became Mr. Boogedy. He moves over to two mannequins of William Hanover and Widow Marion]
Hanover fell in love with Marion. In fact, he wanted to marry her.
She didn't, did she?
Ah, ah ha ha ha! She turned him down!
[makes the Widow Marion mannequin put its arm over its face]

But that wasn't the end of it! Not hardly! Hanover was ready to do anything, I mean anything, to win the hand of the Widow Marion. After all, he was a man of *great* power and authority! Used to having things his own way! Some people say, he sold his soul to the devil, that night! Sold his soul, for a magic cloak! He he he! A cloak so powerful, it would make him, invisible! A cloak so powerful, he hoped, it would even bring him the Widow Marion! More than anything in this world, he wanted Marion! So one day, when Marion's little boy Jonathan, had a terrile cold, and was on their to the doctor, who should JUMP out of the woods! In his brand new magic cloak!
Mr. Boogedy?

Right! And he, TOOK Jonathan! Back to his house! And then, he threatened Marion, that if she didn't marry him! If she didn't marry him that very night! She would never, ever see poor little Jonathan again! And just to make sure, that she went along with all this? Mr. Boogedy decided to, cast his very first spell! With the magic cloak! Heh Heh! But, uh, something happened.
What happened?
Ah! He, blew up his own house! Heh Heh Heh!
He BLEW up his own house?
What a dope!

[snaps his finger]
Just like magic! The whole house disappeared! And, every house that has been built on that site! Has been haunted!
But, what happened to Mr. Boogedy?
And Jonathan?
And Widow Marion?
They all became ghosts, heh heh heh heh! And poor Marion! Is still trying to get her Jonathan back! In fact! Jonathan still has his cold!
That's why I heard sneezing!
Yeah, long time to have a cold!
Well, no one ever said being a ghost was easy!
So, what are we gonna do?
Well... if were me... I'd move.

[to Neil Witherspoon as he exits the house]
Thanks a lot! Don't ever change!
[to his family]
OK, let's take a look around our new home! What do you think, huh?

[Corwin and R.E. are exploring the basement of the new house. R.E. holds his fuzzy teddy bear and sees a minature rocking chair]
Hey Corwin!
What?

[puts the teddy bear in the rocker]
Look! It's just his size!
Big deal.
[looks behind some large boxes and hears a low growling]
Hey, R.E.! Over here, over here!
[R.E. comes to investigate. The growling gets louder, and... ]

[at the top of the staircase, turns on the light]
Find any ghosts, fellas?
Na.
No.
Well, maybe you'll have better luck tomorrow. Come on.

[walks back over to the rocker to get his teddy bear, which is now empty]
Hey! Where'd he go!
Come on, R.E., it's getting late.
But, dad! My fuzzy teddy bear's gone!
Reginald Ernest Davis, MOVE!
[R.E. wimpers, and walks up the stairs]
Come on.
[turns off the light and closes the door. We see the now empty rocker, begin to rock again, by itself]

[the kids are trying to tell Carleton and Eloise about the house being haunted and Mr. Boogedy, but Carleton keeps joking around]
OK. What is it?
OK. We went to the Historical Society...

[interupts]
No wait, wait, wait! You gotta see this!
[pulls out a fake mummy]
Isn't he great?
[holds the mummy upright]
Oh, gee wiz! I'm sad, because I lost my mummy!
[Eloise laughs]
[Evil cackle]
Hey! Whoa, boy! What was that?

[all together]
Ghosts!
Oh, yeah, sure. So, uh, how'd you guys do that?
Daddy, please?
Come on, Dad!
No, it's great, really! I'm not mad, I just want to know how you did it.
Dad, the house is haunted!
Hmm, hmm, hmm. Haunted?
It's Mr. Boogedy!
OK, I don't know how you guys are doing that, but one thing I do know, this house is not haunted!

[Immediately, things in the room start going off. The organ plays by itself, the lights dim up and down, the fake mummy comes to life and begins dancing around to the organ music, ghost hands fill out the monster gloves and start to clap in mid-air. As the music reaches its peak, the mummy swings its arms around three times, then collapses in a heap, the room returning to normal. Carleton looks to Eloise]
Hmm.
Well, that's it! Time to call a realtor!
Eloise, how can you say that?

[points to her mouth]
Time to call, a realtor!
But you mean move!
I think we otta go, right now!
No, no, it's late, the boys are tired...

[together]
We're not tired!
I'm not spending another night in this house, it's full of ghosts!
Wait! Wait! Hold it, everybody! I got an idea, uh, sleeping bags! We have sleeping bags... uh, we'll camp out!

[in the kitchen making a sandwich, Eloise hears a tapping sound]
Hmm.
[continues to make her sandwich, hears a distinct tapping noise three times]
Is someone tap, tap, tapping at my window?
[hears the tapping three times again, opens the kitchen door and steps out. The ghost of Widow Marian appears]
Are you a, g... ghost?
Yes.
Oh, dear. Well, would you like to come in, or, uh, have a cup of coffee?
[Window Marion begins to sob]
Is it something about coffee, dear? Something too painful for ghosts? About coffee?
I cannot enter your home.
Well, yes you can, you certaintly can, if I invite you.
Mr. Boogedy prevented me!
He prevented you?
[voice goes into a squeak]
How dareth he!
He has kept me from my son, for over three-hundred years!
[recognizes the ghost]
You're Widow Marian!
Yes!
Oh, well this *is* a pleasure! Because the children were just telling us all about you! Oh, come, please, you must come in, you must!
You don't understand! As long as Mr. Boogedy dwells within, the magic that keepets him there, also keepets me out! And apart from my Jonathan!
[starts to sob again]
Ooooohhhhh.

[Eloise has told Carleton and the kids about her encounter with Widow Marian]
You saw her? Did she have fangs and stuff? Like a vampire?
Did she have a lot of gooky stuff oozing out of her face?
She was a very nice woman, R.E. And she misses her little boy, very, very much.
This is horrible, Eloise, just awful. We have to do something about this.
Yeah!
Yeah, Mom! What did the ghost lady tell you to do?
We have to get rid of Mr. Boogedy... get rid of his *cloak*.

[the Davis family has exorcised Mr. Boogedy by sucking his cloak into the vaccum cleaner. We see two orbs, a red and blue one, float in and form the ghosts of Widow Marian and Jonathan. Jonathan and Widow Marian embrace]
Jonathan!
Mama!
Oh, thank you! Thank you so much! R.E.?
[she reaches to R.E. to embrace him]
[R.E. goes over to Widow Marian and hugs her]
You were very brave, R.E.
I knew you could do it! Achoo!
Here you go, son.
[hands Jonathan a tissue, which upon Jonathan's touch, turns into a cloth napkin]
Thank you. Achoo!
[blows his nose into the napkin. Mother and son step back, revert into grey orbs and float out the window]

[patting Jennifer's hand]
Jennifer? Jennifer, honey, are you OK?Are you all right?
What happened?
We found you lying here, honey. You were clicking your heels together and all you would say is, there's no place like home! There's no place like home!
I saw him! I saw him!
Who?
The Boogedy Man! His face was all yucky! Like a grilled cheese sandwich, or something!
Look, look! There's nobody here! What, what Boogedy Man?

[points to the wall]
Look, it's his footprints!
Oh, that is strange!
Slimy footprints!
Eeeewwwww!

[Carleton walks up to the wall and examines the green footprints going up the wall to the ceiling]
Careful, Carleton. You don't want to get that on your pajamas!
Oh, boy! These are great! Look at this!
[pulls a footprint off the wall]
Ha ha! I can sell these! I can! I can sell these! Aren't they great? Look, they stick to things!
[sticks the footprint back on the wall]
I don't believe this!
Shhh, it's gonna be all right, darlin'...
You know what? You know, I bet Neil Witherspoon set this up! Aw, man! Do you believe it? Is this a great gag?
No, Daddy! It wasn't Neil! It was the Boogedy Man!
Maybe you had a nightmare, honey...
But I saw him, right here!
Did he have big teeth!
Was he gonna eat ya?
Maybe he's gonna come back and get her after she goes to sleep! Wooo! Ha!
Woooooo!
All right boys, that's enough!

[looking innocent]
Mom, we're just trying to help.

[the Davis family are all sitting in their bedclothes on top of their sleeping bags, in front of a roaring fireplace]
It was a dark, and stormy night... full of shadows, dark and slimy, creepy things. Suddenly, there was a noise...
[a bang is heard in the distance]
It sounded like... like... Aaaaaaaaahhhhhhhhhhh!
[everyone jumps]
Daddy, what are you doing?
Well, you're supposed to tell scary stories, when you're sitting around the old campfire, darlin'!
Yeah, Jennifer!
This isn't the old campfire, it's the old fireplace! And we're sitting on the floor of this stupid ol' haunted house...
[we see a mangled hand at Jennifer's shoulder reaching towards her face]
...and any minute some dumb ghost is going to come up and...
[sees the hand]
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHhhhhhhhh!
[Corwin is wearing a fake monster glove and starts laughing]
Oh my God, Corwin! Corwin, I'm gonna kill you!
All right, all right! Carleton, Carleton, let's not talk any more about ghosts!
OK everyone, momma's spoken! Time to hit the hay, let's go!
Aw, shucks!
Awwwwww!
Come on, everyone. Get in your sleeping bags, Corwin? Good boy, son.
Ah, did anybody leave a weird green light on in that room?
